item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Monday, December 16, 2024 at 9:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Xiaomi Home Integration for Home Assistant (339 points | 154 comments)
2. Popeye and Tintin enter the public domain in 2025 along with Faulkner, Hemingway (60 points | 13 comments)
3. Veo 2: Our video generation model (201 points | 107 comments)
4. Lfgss shutting down 16th March 2025 (day before Online Safety Act is enforced) (198 points | 121 comments)
5. Go Protobuf: The New Opaque API (33 points | 10 comments)
6. In Search of a Faster SQLite (138 points | 53 comments)
7. What did Ada Lovelace's program actually do? (2018) (136 points | 44 comments)
8. Why is it so hard to buy things that work well? (2022) (373 points | 344 comments)
9. Ruby Video – On a mission to index all Ruby conferences (79 points | 5 comments)
10. Modelica (180 points | 58 comments)
11. Quick takes on the recent OpenAI public incident write-up (18 points | 1 comment)
12. Using Guile for Emacs (82 points | 27 comments)
13. Our muscles will atrophy as we climb the Kardashev Scale (51 points | 67 comments)
14. Converge (YC S23) is hiring founding engineer #2 ( | hide)
15. Konwinski Prize (97 points | 31 comments)
16. Backward-incompatible GRUB2 change causing BIOS setup bootloop (32 points | 5 comments)
17. Mirror bacteria research poses significant risks, scientists warn (76 points | 90 comments)
18. Images of gamma-ray flare from supermassive black hole M87 (26 points | 2 comments)
19. OpenERV (733 points | 232 comments)
20. "Nvidia is so far ahead that all the 4090s are nerfed to half speed" (107 points | 59 comments)
21. Absinthe: From Green Fairy to Moral Panic (8 points | discuss)
22. Ask HN: SWEs how do you future-proof your career in light of LLMs? (105 points | 201 comments)
23. UK's Online Safety Act comes into force (113 points | 132 comments)
24. Finding the Mango's Origin (2017) (9 points | 1 comment)
25. Pelicans on a bicycle (49 points | 39 comments)
26. Show HN: Autonomous AI agents that monitor the stock market for you (11 points | 6 comments)
27. Nokia 5110 – Back from the Dead (2022) (233 points | 111 comments)
28. The Qualcomm DSP Driver – Unexpectedly excavating an exploit (82 points | 23 comments)
29. Show HN: NCompass Technologies – yet another AI Inference API, but hear us out (16 points | 17 comments)
30. Sci-fi inspired antenna adjusts to signal needs (35 points | 3 comments)
